data.title: Yum was off the charts
data.text: Showed up here on a Sunday morning. We had to wait around 15minutes outside sipping on our morning coffees. The line was out the door but we knew our breakfasts would be delicious. Families, hipsters and the general cool factor were in full affect. I ate the huevos rancheros, my wife had the hash and griddle veggie dish. My friend had the pancakes and damn... it was aaaallll good. Easy as that. I'd suggest you don't come here so I can have this place all to myself. ;) come here for a wait but some really tasty food, lovely pastries and some fun sights/vibe. Check out my food pics... price point wasn't too bad for the quality food.... 32 bucks with tip for two of us. Hence why we only come here once in a while for a spot on breakfast.

data.title: Breakfast and treats
data.text: We stopped here for breakfast before heading out of St. Paul.  Get there early on Sunday, they get very busy.   Service was great and friendly and food was outstanding.   Try the Twinkies!

data.title: Quirky and Cute
data.text:
Had 3 1/2 for lunch, three adults and a rambunctious two year old for lunch.  We blended with the lunch crowd. I did find it strange how we ordered at a counter, found seating and waited for the food delivery, but have found out since that this is fairly standard in this area.

I had a delicious BLT and despite being this late in the growing season the tomato was wonderful. 

Quick food preparation and everyone was pleased with their food

data.title: Busy Saturday visit
data.text: We arrived on a busy Sunday and waited 45 minutes for a table.  The crab cakes with poached eggs, coffee and pastry items were great.  We also ordered pancakes unfortunately they were regrettable-- overdone on the outside and under done on the inside.  I was really surprised by the uneven customer service.  Our waitress was Johnny on spot with coffee refills but was flighty.  We ordered a pastry to go and she returned within a couple minutes with the check and no pastry.  We would definitely return for pastries, they were outstanding.

data.title: Very good
data.text: Not as good as all the raves I have read about it but it is still a worthwhile stop for breakfast or lunch.

data.title: As always...awesome
data.text: I have been to the buttered tin many a time and it has yet to disappoint.  The staff is always friendly, the food is always great, and the price is right.  I can hardly say enough about this place and recommend this locale to anyone of my friends or family who come into town.  Thank you buttered Tin!

data.title: So good.
data.text: It was so good we had to return the next morning to try something different.  They say you eat with your eyes and these breakfasts were an eye full and so delicious.  French toast with caramelized bananas, special egg dishes and friendly service.  In and out seating very casual.  You go for the food not the decor.

data.title: Perfect portions, delicious food!
data.text: This is a small bakery and cafe with limited seating but wonderful food. You order at the counter, then sit down and wait for your food. And you can have a mimosa with breakfast!  You have a choice of orange or grapefruit juice; I chose orange, the husband had a Belgian Pale Ale.   He had the Eggs Benedict while I ordered the daily special Loaded Hash Browns.  We both completely enjoyed our breakfasts, both of which came with a small side salad with a light vinaigrette.  The portion sizes are not huge, but I consider that a plus - you're not left feeling stuffed.  Just perfect.  As an aside, treat yourself to a blueberry hand pie to go, or one of their   house-made "twinkies" - you will not be sorry!

data.title: Decent food but way overpriced
data.text: Stopped here for breakfast recently. The food was pretty decent, but definitely does not stand out from other breakfast restaurants in the area. What does stand out was the price. I ordered pancakes, bacon, and a cup of coffee. My bill was $22 and that was before tip. I went as a group of 8 people, and everyone was shocked at the prices. I guarantee none of us will be back unless the prices go down to something close to reasonable.

data.title: Reliable breakfast spot
data.text: Only had to wait about 10 minutes for a table, but the food was a long time in coming. The bananas foster french toast is a favorite but maybe order some bacon to cut the sweetness! Food was good, but maybe not worth more than a 20 minute wait, since there are other good breakfast and brunch options in the area.

data.title: Pleasant surprise near MSP Amtrack
data.text: About 4 blocks from the station.  In house made pastries and granola.  Delicious coffee.  Creative breakfast egg dishes.  Very pleasant and helpful staff.

data.title: Cool breakfast and lunch joint in DT St. Paul
data.text: Met friends for breakfast here after flying in from ATL.  Good food, Great Bacon and good bread/cakes/rolls/biscuits.  Decent service, smallish dining area made it a little tight, even with the overflow space.

data.title: Amazing breakfast
data.text: During a lay over in st paul, we picked this place based on TA reviews.  At 10am Sunday, there was a twenty minute wait, but the staff were very accommodating ( I wear a large brace). Good was outstanding .  Ginger lavender lemonade. buttermilk pancakes with bacon, maple butter and real maple syrup. Best I've ever eaten. My wife had heuvos rancheros on house made corn bread, avocado, and just tastes great. Really, you can't lose on this menu.

data.title: Great bakery and other food
data.text: Buttered Tin has great fresh bakery and food. Weekends during the summer can be busy if the weather is nice.  Take out is just as good if you don't want to wait!

data.title: Tale of 2 plates
data.text:
Went for breakfast at the recommendation of locals.

Mine was fine, nothing special.  I got the house-made sausage took one bite and declared it inedible.  My husband tried it and declared it ok.  Big mistake.   

Now Trip Advisor has advised me that I can't write the words "food pois......ing" unless I am positive that it was FP.  So all I will write is that my husband spent the next 23 hours sick as a dog.

We won't be back.

data.title: Great food, long wait
data.text:
We picked this place based on other reviews. We waited 25 min (as they said we would for a seat), 40 min for our food and another dish came 5 min later. 

Pros
Friendly service
Food quality is fantastic 
Clean and charming

Cons
Felt like a long wait for breakfast. If you want to spend 1.5 hours at breakfast then maybe it's fine

data.title: What a Gem
data.text: Neat place in St Paul MN.. Great coffee and awesome breakfast place..Close to CHS field..we were in town for the weekend and went on the recommendation of friends..

data.title: Best Biscuts and Baked Goods
data.text:
I stop here often to get baked goods when I'm out and about. Try the hand pies (flavored change daily) but get there early for the sausage or ham biscuits. 
I love to stop and get a treat and walk down to Mears park and enjoy watching the people and the water fall. Parking is cheaper north of here along 10th st, and you can spend your savings on a yummy confection.

data.title: Lovely Organic, Locally Sourced,Breakfast Fare
data.text: We had a wonderful first visit to this place I'd heard so much about.  Not your typical bakery menu. We had the fabulous Crabcake Benedict. The flavors were excellent and the hollandaise was delicately laced with lemon and it both complimented and completed this dish- not overwhelming at all. And the Carmel roll....oh my!! We'll be back and will bring our friends!

data.title: Great Breakfast - Fresh and well sourced ingredients!
data.text:
We had three days in St. Paul and ate here twice - it is simply that good.  Food is fresh, high quality with a great presentation.  Coffee is hot and strong.  On Thursday and it was low-key with plenty of seating. On Saturday at about 9 am we had a 15 minute wait and it was full and bustling.  Plan accordingly.

The menu is short but clearly there is great care in designing it. The breakfast tacos are amazing - with both a soft and hard shell and bursting with flavor.  The Banana Foster  french toast was delicious - our son described the bananas as so intensely flavorful it was if there were bananas inside the bannas and The eggs benedict over crabcakes was to die for.  We really sampled the menu and all were very happy with everything we ordered.
